comments:
Build ID: I20070621-1340

Steps To Reproduce:
1. Submit a pdf using OHF Document source to repository.

Error : SOAP Fault:  An error occurred while serializing the SOAP message.

Not enough information is below to discern the problem. Please submit the debug level logs. 

Thanks!

Here is what i am setting in code :

documentPath = "c:/ScanSample.pdf";

SubmitTransactionData txnData = new SubmitTransactionData();
Source source = new Source(IBMRepositoryURL);

clinicalDocument = new Document(new File(documentPath),DocumentDescriptor.PDF);

docEntryUUID = txnData.addDocument(clinicalDocument);
DocumentEntryType docEntry = txnData.getDocumentEntry(docEntryUUID);
docEntry.setPatientId(patient);

... setting other metadata info
				
source.submit(txnData, "test");

----------------
The Error i am getting is related to serializing the SOAP message.

There are many, many things that can cause a SOAP Fault. I will need the debug log to see what is happening. To set debug log mode - you will need to update your
log4j configuration XML file so that all categories are on debug:

Example:
  <category name="org.eclipse.ohf.ihe.xds.soap">
    <priority value="debug" />
 </category >


Then this file needs to be loaded at runtime (so need to add the following to your code):

File conf = new File(<path to your log4j configuration>);
org.apache.log4j.xml.DOMConfigurator.configure(conf.getAbsolutePath());

more information on Log4j can be found here:
http://logging.apache.org/log4j/1.2/index.html

An example log4j configuration file can be found in:
org.eclipse.ohf.ihe.xds.source/resources/conf/submitTest_log4j.xml

hope this helps.

Created an attachment (id=80498)
Application log file

Log file..

Please run again and set the following categories to "debug" in your log4j xml configuration:
	
  	<category name="org.apache.axiom">
    	<priority value="info" />
	</category >	

  	<category name="org.apache.axis2">
    	<priority value="info" />
	</category >	

  	<category name="org.apache.commons.httpclient">
    	<priority value="info" />
	</category >	

  	<category name="org.apache.commons.httpclient.Wire">
    	<priority value="none" />
	</category >	

I'll need to see the "Wire" stuff.
Thanks!

Also to note - you have a folder in Metadata - that probably should not be there
See the code in:
org.eclipse.ohf.ihe.xds.source.test.mesa.Mesa11746_Option1 and the test files in
org.eclipse.ohf.ihe.xds.source/resources/sample_files/test1 for examples of metadata that is required for submission.

Hi -
please let me know if this SOAP Fault is still a problem. 
- Sarah

Please note this is an error against the 2007 IHE code.  For 2008 the sending / serialization mechanism was rewritten.

However, this looks like a bug in the stable branch.  I will investigate further.

Hi Sarah,

Actually i was trying to submit a PDF file directly to the repository.
Which is valid or not, i don't know exactly.

But i am able to submit a Wrapped PDF (Base64 Encoded) inside the CDA R2 XML
document and same able to retrive also.

Can you please tell me, Is it possible to directly sumit the PDF to repository
without Wrapping inside the CDA R2 XML Document.

Thanks,

Umesh...

Hi Umesh - 

Matt had discovered a fact I missed - that you are using the 2007 branch. Before connectathon - please update to the main branch in which the current code for the 2008 connectathon is. That said - we are now trying to replicate your problem. The code should not be blowing up like this - so we are working on a fix. That said - for IHE - they are looking for vendors to submit healthcare documents (like CDA or XDS-SD), preferably. So though pure PDF is not prohibited, it is not encouraged. This is a good item to discuss with your connectathon coach at your preliminary interview. We'll keep looking into this issue.

- Sarah

Trial fix has been committed to OHF_IHE_2007_BRANCH.  Applied to revision 1.1.2.1 of org.eclipse.ohf.ihe.xds.soap.SoapSerializer.java and revision 1.2.2.1 of org.eclipse.ohf.ihe.xds.soap.XDSSoapClientAXIS2.java.

Umesh, the version of OHF that you're using outdates this commit by a while, otherwise I would attach a new JAR for you to use.  If you're working against a CVS version, please check out again in the branch OHF_IHE_2007_BRANCH and try.  However, as I believe Sarah said below, this code is intended for use with the IHE 06/07 infrastructure.

Created an attachment (id=80696)
IHE 0.2.0 Milestone 3 pre-release.

Please see the attached ZIP file containing new JARs for this fix.
